sentence.Network_en: Facts: A Virgina statute prohibits interracial marriages between whites and blacks.
sentence.Network_cn: 弗吉尼亚州某法禁止白人和黑人的种族间通婚.

sentence.Network_en: Even now, mixed couples face many obstacles, including laws restricting interracial marriage.
sentence.Network_cn: 即使是现在, 异族男女之间的婚姻仍然面临着重重阻碍, 包括限制异族通婚的法律.

sentence.Network_en: The world would be better off if there were more interracial marriages.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果有更多的跨种族婚姻,这个世界会更好.

Sentence.sentence: Researchers also observed problems resulting from pairing interracial students in residences.
An Indiana University study found that interracial roommates were three times as likely as two white roommates to no longer live together by the end of the semester
I've experienced roommate conflicts between interracial students that have both broken down stereotypes and reinforced stereotypes," said one Penn resident advisor (RA).
Russell Fazio, an Ohio State psychology professor who has studied interracial roommates there and at Indiana University, discovered an intriguing academic effect.
That same study found that randomly assigned interracial roommates at Ohio State broke up before the end of the quarter about twice as often as same-race roommates
Because interracial roommate relationships are often problematic, Dr. Fazio said, many students would like to move out, but university housing policies may make it hard to leave.
